alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 9:52AM CDT until May 15 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Clayton and Grant Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Wisconsin... Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Grant, Allamakee, Crawford and Clayton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at McGregor. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins, and access to parks near the river in Prairie du Chien is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday morning and continue falling to 14.1 feet next Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 06/28/1943. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
